diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Superficial spreading malignant melanoma, 0.91 mm in thickness, with metastasis to one of two sentinel lymph nodes.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a flat, pigmented lesion that had changed in characteristics over time, including itching, elevation, and bleeding. A punch biopsy previously reported an atypical Spitz tumor. Upon re-excision, the pathological examination showed a superficial spreading malignant melanoma with certain histologic features, including vertical growth phase and dermal mitoses. A sentinel lymph node biopsy subsequently confirmed metastatic melanoma in one of the nodes.
